SECURITY IN THE CASE OF A CONDITIONAL RIGHT
When an heir's or legatee's right is postponed due to it not yet being the correct time, or it is limited to a certain time, or is postponed due to an as yet unfulfilled condition, or it is dependent on a resolutory condition or an order that counts as a resolutory condition, the court shall, following a motion by the affected persons, order temporary measures to secure the portion of the estate in question in accordance with the Act regulating execution and security, unless otherwise determined by the will.
